intro: Neobotrydium procerum, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense, spherical head, typical of the daisy family. Native to South America, it thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
